resources.string: Welcome to Udacity Tour Guide App. Explore different cities from menu.
Jaipur, the \'Pink City\', is one of the most royal, majestic and colourful cities of India with a very strong historical background and vibrant culture.
Located in a valley and surrounded by 4 lakes, it is at times referred to as the \'Kashmir of Rajasthan\'.
Situated close to the Pakistan Border, the Golden City is a major tourist spot owing to its proximity to the Thar Desert.
The only hill station of Rajasthan, its cool atmosphere and lush green surroundings make it a major tourist spot
The Gateway of India is, without doubt, one of the most popular tourist hotspots of Mumbai. It is located at Apollo Bunder Waterfront and overlooks the Arabian Sea in the most beautiful way.
Marine Drive is a km long, arc shaped boulevard along the South Mumbai coast, starting from the southern end of Nariman Point and ending at the famous Chowpatty beach.
Juhu beach is the longest beach in Mumbai, and arguably the most popular among tourists as well.
One of the most crowded and electrifying places to visit in Mumbai is the Colaba Causeway, famous for being the shopping paradise and having endless shops to choose from.
One of the most beautiful place in Delhi. It is located in East Delhi and can be accessed by Delhi Metro.
Among the most visited tourist place in Delhi, near kalkaji mandir and nehru place metro station.
Largest Masjid in India. Religious place. Beautiful.
Famous for it\'s Amar Jyoti i.e. In the name of brave soldiers
Also known as Lal Qila, Fort Rouge or Red Fort of Agra, the Agra Fort is a UNESCO world heritage site.
The Taj Mahal is one of the seven wonders of the world and is considered to be the most popular tourist attraction in the country.
A city, predominantly made of red sand stone, Fatehpur Sikri was once the capital of Mughal Emperor Akbar.
This tomb nestled on the bank of the river Yamuna was built by Queen Noor Jahan for her parents in the middle of the Persian Garden.
